title.narrative: Economic & Monetary Community of Central Africa Financial Institutions

description.narrative: The project aims to strengthen Central African regional institutions so that they can fulfill their mandates to encourage an expanded, better governed regional market, and a more transparent, better regulated and more competitive financial system. This will facilitate the re-utilization of oil revenues for investment in Central Africa. The project supports programs approved by the member governments designed to improve the efficiency of regional institutions. This will be accomplished by strengthening regional institutions. Project outcome indicators are given in Annex 3 and include increases in the percentage of foreign reserves managed regionally byBEAC, growth of investment in regional projects (primarily infrastructure investments), and increases in the percentage of banks meeting key prudential norms.

title.narrative: Growth of BDEAC financing of regional projects.

comment.narrative: The level of BDEAC's investment has surpassed the target of CFA 15 billion. The task team does not feel that this indicator issuitable to measure the project's assistance to BEAC. A new performance target is being discussed with the beneficiary BDEAC.

title.narrative: Monetary programming conducted at regional level by Y4

comment.narrative: Monetary programming only at national level

Substantial progress is being made by harmonizing the type of date collecting and establishing a system which allows the relevantinstitution to have access to the data. Consulting firm has started its work.

title.narrative: Banks accounting for percentage increase of sector assets complying with agreed prudential norms by end of project.

comment.narrative: The indicator was originally entered incorrectly in the system. Based on the PAD, it should read "Banks accounting for 80% ofsector assets complying with agreed prudential norms by end of project.
Banks representing 80% of sector assets complying with agreed prudential norms by end of project.

Not updated. This percentage is not tracked by the banking commission (COBAC). As such, it is not available. The task team feelsthat it is not the most suitable indicator to measure the impact of the project's assistance to COBAC.

title.narrative: Increase in percentage of foreign reserves managed regionally by BEAC

comment.narrative: BEAC manages 50% of its foreign reserves. To help strengthen BEAC's ability to manage its reserve the Project has recruited aWorldclass fund manager who is working with BEAC.

title.narrative: Improved portfolio performance of BDEAC, as measured by increased ratio of annual disbursements/commitments in the preceding year from 43% in 2007 to 70% by Y3

comment.narrative: While improving from the 43%, the ration is currently at 55% and falls short of the 70%target.

title.narrative: Central Bank/Government paper issued by Y3 (none issued now)

target.value: Central Bank/Government paper issued by Y3

comment.narrative: The Government of Cameroon issued bonds which were over subscribed. Cameron may issue more. Gabon issued successfully new billsonMay 8. CFAF 10 billion were issued by tender on the regional CEMAC market. In October 2013, Chad also issued bonds.The issuecarriesa 1.5 percent interest and has a three-month maturity. The issuance has been done in the context of the implementation ofthe CEMACregulations replacing statutory advances from the regional central bank (BEAC) with the issuance of Government securitiesto finance treasury needs.

title.narrative: New BDEAC's MIS, including accounting system, substantially in place by mid-term and generating financial reports in line with international standards by Y5

target.value: In place by mid-term and generating financial reports in line with international standards by Y5

comment.narrative: The mission was at BDEAC headquarters and saw first hand that the new MIS was not in place. The mission is also concerned aboutinternal discontent which could hamper the setting up of the MIS

title.narrative: All projects evaluated by BDEAC according to new policies by Y3.

comment.narrative: BDEAC does not have a standard policy and set of procedures to evaluate its projects in a uniform manner. The project is helpingaddress this gap with a technical assistance.

title.narrative: Plan for application of microfinance regulatory framework and supervision system in place and applied by mid-term review

target.value: In place and applied by mid-term review

actual.value: The application is in place but the regulatory framework needs to be improved to hanlde a more sophisticated micro finance sector,which is now managing relatively high level of deposits.

title.narrative: Updated accounting plan for banks in place and used by banks by Y3

target.value: In place and used by banks by Y3

actual.value: The updated accounting plan for banks is in place.

title.narrative: Revised and applied BDEAC's policies, procedures and internal controls by Y3

comment.narrative: A new MIS is being purchased. At the same time, a new Human Resources strategy has been developed, and has been adopted.

title.narrative: Cross-border electronic payments transactions in wholesale and retail systems (SYGMA and SYSTAC) cumulative increase of 33% by Y3 and 61% by Y5.

baseline.value: (SYGMA and SYSTAC) cumulative increase of 33% by Y3

target.value: (SYGMA and SYSTAC) cumulative increase of 61% by Y5.

comment.narrative: The wholesale and retail system is being updated. measure activities financed under the project and which have limited bearing onthe increase of electronic payments.
